description: Latin  deturpare; de + turpare (“to make ugly, defile”), turpis (“ugly, foul”).

verbs.description: deturpate (third-person singular simple present deturpates, present participle deturpating, simple past and past participle deturpated)

examples: Such as that which is to be seen in Burchards , and such which are too largely described in Sanchez ; which thing does not only deturpate all honest and modest conversation , but it teaches men to understand more sins then ever they knew of.
